1.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
1.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
I stretch forth, mid: I hanker after, long for, am eager for, aspire to.
beautiful, as an outward sign of the inward good, noble, honorable character; good, worthy, honorable, noble, and seen to be so.
work, task, employment; a deed, action; that which is wrought or made, a work.

1.brief: I long for, covet, lust after
1.long: I long for, covet, lust after, set the heart upon.

2.long: it is necessary, inevitable; less frequently: it is a duty, what is proper.
(used as an official title in civil life), overseer, supervisor, ruler, especially used with reference to the supervising function exercised by an elder or presbyter of a church or congregation.

2.brief: a male human being, a man
2.long: a male human being; a man, husband.
sober, not intoxicated (with wine), temperate, vigilant.
of sound mind, self-controlled, temperate, sober-minded, modest, chaste.

2.brief: able to teach, apt to teach
2.long: able to teach, apt to teach.

3.long: gentle, mild, forbearing, fair, reasonable, moderate.
peaceable, abstaining from fighting, not contentious.

4.long: one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.
(a) a house, the material building, (b) a household, family, lineage, nation.
I preside, rule over, give attention to, direct, maintain, practice diligently.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

4.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
4.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

5.brief: but, on the other hand, and
5.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.
(a) a house, the material building, (b) a household, family, lineage, nation.
I preside, rule over, give attention to, direct, maintain, practice diligently.
how, in what manner, by what means.
an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.

5.brief: I take care of, attend to
5.long: I take care of, attend to.

6.long: (lit: newly-planted), newly converted to Christianity, recent convert.
I puff up, make haughty; pass: I am puffed up, am haughty.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
(a) a judgment, a verdict; sometimes implying an adverse verdict, a condemnation, (b) a case at law, a lawsuit.

6.brief: I fall in, am cast in
6.long: I fall in, am cast in, am involved in.
(adj. used often as a noun), slanderous; with the article: the Slanderer (par excellence), the Devil.

7.long: it is necessary, inevitable; less frequently: it is a duty, what is proper.

7.brief: but, on the other hand, and
7.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
beautiful, as an outward sign of the inward good, noble, honorable character; good, worthy, honorable, noble, and seen to be so.
(a) from outside, from without, (b) outside, both as adj. and prep; with article: the outside.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

7.brief: I fall in, am cast in
7.long: I fall in, am cast in, am involved in.
a snare, trap (especially for catching birds) hence, met: stratagem, device, wile.
(adj. used often as a noun), slanderous; with the article: the Slanderer (par excellence), the Devil.

8.long: a waiter, servant; then of any one who performs any service, an administrator.
in like manner, likewise, just so.

8.brief: I pay attention to, devote myself to
8.long: (a) I attend to, pay attention to, (b) I beware, am cautious, (c) I join, devote myself to.

9.long: a mystery, secret, of which initiation is necessary; in the NT: the counsels of God, once hidden but now revealed in the Gospel or some fact thereof; the Christian revelation generally; particular truths or details of the Christian revelation.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
clean, pure, unstained, either literally or ceremonially or spiritually; guiltless, innocent, upright.

10.brief: but, on the other hand, and
10.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.

10.brief: I put to the test, prove, examine
10.long: I put to the test, prove, examine; I distinguish by testing, approve after testing; I am fit.
first, in the first place, before, formerly.
then, thereafter, next (marking a fresh stage); therefore, then, furthermore.
I wait at table (particularly of a slave who waits on guests); I serve (generally).

11.long: in like manner, likewise, just so.
(adj. used often as a noun), slanderous; with the article: the Slanderer (par excellence), the Devil.
sober, not intoxicated (with wine), temperate, vigilant.

11.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
11.long: all, the whole, every kind of.

12.long: a waiter, servant; then of any one who performs any service, an administrator.

12.brief: a male human being, a man
12.long: a male human being; a man, husband.
I preside, rule over, give attention to, direct, maintain, practice diligently.
one's own, belonging to one, private, personal; one's own people, one's own family, home, property.
(a) a house, the material building, (b) a household, family, lineage, nation.

13.long: I wait at table (particularly of a slave who waits on guests); I serve (generally).

13.brief: a step, a stage, a position
13.long: a step (of a stairway); hence: a stage in a career, a position.
beautiful, as an outward sign of the inward good, noble, honorable character; good, worthy, honorable, noble, and seen to be so.
I acquire, earn, purchase, make my own, preserve alive.
freedom, openness, especially in speech; boldness, confidence.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
Jesus; the Greek form of Joshua; Jesus, son of Eliezer; Jesus, surnamed Justus.

14.long: I write; pass: it is written, it stands written (in the scriptures).
I hope, hope for, expect, trust.

15.brief: but, on the other hand, and
15.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
I am slow, I delay, tarry.
how, in what manner, by what means.
it is necessary, inevitable; less frequently: it is a duty, what is proper.
(a) a house, the material building, (b) a household, family, lineage, nation.

15.brief: I overturn, turn upside down, return, mid. and pass: I conduct myself, live
15.long: I overturn; I turn back, return; I turn hither and thither; pass: I turn myself about; I sojourn, dwell; I conduct myself, behave, live.
an assembly, congregation, church; the Church, the whole body of Christian believers.
truth, but not merely truth as spoken; truth of idea, reality, sincerity, truth in the moral sphere, divine truth revealed to man, straightforwardness.

16.long: large, great, in the widest sense.

a mystery, secret, of which initiation is necessary; in the NT: the counsels of God, once hidden but now revealed in the Gospel or some fact thereof; the Christian revelation generally; particular truths or details of the Christian revelation.

16.brief: I make clear, visible, or manifest
16.long: I make clear (visible, manifest), make known.
flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

16.brief: I make righteous, defend the cause of, justify
16.long: I make righteous, defend the cause of, plead for the righteousness (innocence) of, acquit, justify; hence: I regard as righteous.
I see, look upon, experience, perceive, discern, beware.
a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel, conveying news or behests from God to men.
a race, people, nation; the nations, heathen world, Gentiles.
I believe, have faith in, trust in; pass: I am entrusted with.
the world, universe; worldly affairs; the inhabitants of the world; adornment.
I take up, raise; I pick up, take on board; I carry off, lead away.
honor, renown; glory, an especially divine quality, the unspoken manifestation of God, splendor.
